channel.title: [PHP] Creating a server status page with txt files

item.title: [PHP] Creating a server status page with txt files
item.dc:creator: @sppt sppt
item.description:
@sppt wrote:

[quote=“OnlyOneRule, post:1, topic:253988”][quote author=sppt link=topic=335302.msg2609091#msg2609091 date=1230688511]
why store in plaintext if you can do it in XML though?
[/quote]
It would be very simple to do. All you need to do is adjust some of the functions to parse XML. I just never really looked into XML before. You wouldn’t happen to know of any tutorials?[/quote]
I made a server status page using XML.
There’s 3 major XML parsing classes in php, 1 which isn’t able to write anything save for attributes, but it’s very simple to use.
I prefer using that one (SimpleXML), and writing the xml file myself.
Perhaps it’s bad practise, but it isn’t as fucking hard as the other XML parsers are.

Read full topic
item.source: [PHP] Creating a server status page with txt files
